metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5265 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla Firefox before 48.0 and Firefox ESR 45.x before 45.3 allow user-assisted remote attackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy, and conduct Universal XSS (UXSS) attacks or read arbitrary files, by arranging for the presence of a crafted HTML document and a crafted shortcut file in the same local directory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5265` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
